options.label: An examination of opinions, behaviour, or preferences made by researchers or academics
The process of considering all the information about a situation or a person and making a judgement.
A plan or suggestion, especially a formal or written one, put forward for consideration by others

data.stimulus:
Your next written assignment for the PSE course is a Proposal Report.

 

Let's start by considering what a PROPOSAL is.

► Choose the best definition below.

Next, let's review what a Proposal REPORT is.

 

► Complete the summary with the words below (drag and drop).
data.template:
A proposal report is a {{response}}, informative piece of writing which {{response}} plans and/or suggestions for a {{response}} course of action or change and is submitted for {{response}} by a manager, superiors at work, a business customer, a group of people in a position of authority.

A good proposal report should consist of:

  1. {{response}}, in which the writer states the purpose and content of the report.
  2. {{response}}, in which each aspect or change should be presented under separate {{response}}.
  3. {{response}}, in which the writer summarises all points mentioned above and, if necessary, expresses his/her opinion.

 

NOTE: There are some options that you don't need

options.label: To outline the plans to open a book shop in the Student’s Union
To outline the plans to open a new restaurant in the Student’s Union
To outline the plans to redesign to the library space.

data.stimulus:
Get Ready to Listen  

► Listen to two students discussing a proposal report they are writing.

 

  • Read the questions BEFORE you listen.

  • Then listen and choose the correct answer.

 

 

 1. What is the purpose of the report?

options.label: Location / Staff / Prices / Sales
Location / Staff / Equipment / Products
Location / Staff / Prices / Products

data.stimulus: 2. What are the sub-headings of the report?

options.label: 1st floor of the Student’s Union building
3rd floor of the Student’s Union building
4th floor of the Student’s Union building​​​​​​​

data.stimulus: 3. Which location is suggested?

options.label: Students (on a voluntary time basis)
Students (on a part-time basis)
Students (on a full-time basis)

data.stimulus: 4. Who do they recommend should be employed as staff?

options.label: 20% discount for students
Discount for online purchases
Prices should be kept to a minimum

data.stimulus: 5. What is the proposal for prices?

options.label: Selling only new books
Selling only second-hand books
Selling both new and used/ second-hand books

data.stimulus: 6. What other proposal is made concerning sales?

options.label: The proposal would benefit both the university and the students in a number of ways
The proposal would bring considerable profit to the university
The proposal would improve the reputation of the university

data.stimulus: 7. Why do they feel the Students’ Union should give their proposal serious consideration?

In this part of the lesson, we are going to have a look at a short example of a proposal report.

 

 

► Let's start with the first paragraph:

 

The purpose of this report is to suggest ways to attract more young customers to the bookshop.
Most of the books currently available are quite academic and therefore appeal to older customers. In order to encourage more young people to buy books, the shop should offer magazines and books on topics such as music, fashion and computers.
data.template: In this example, the writer starts by stating a  {{response}}, and then presents a {{response}} to overcome the problem. In the paragraph above, the problem is in {{response}} and the suggestion in {{response}}.

value: At present the shop only sells traditional stationery and calendars.
The prices of the products are quite high and not accessible to this demographic.
The inside of the shop is very plain and old-fashioned.

possible_responses: At present the shop only sells traditional stationery and calendars.
The prices of the products are quite high and not accessible to this demographic.
The inside of the shop is very plain and old-fashioned.
Younger people are more attracted to modern products.
It is important to make the place look fashionable.
data.stimulus:
► Now, let's looks at the rest of the paragraphs:

  • Complete them with a problem from the list below (drag and drop).

 

NOTE: There are some options that you don't need
data.template:
{{response}}. It would be a good idea to expand the product range and stock items designed for young people, such as school equipment, posters, stickers, school bags and games. 
{{response}}. Discounts would encourage local students to buy their textbooks at the bookshop. In addition, leaflets should be given to schools and colleges to make students aware of these discounts. 
{{response}}. Young people might enjoy a more vibrant atmosphere and would be more likely to come in if the decor was modernised and the interior was painted in bright colours. 
In conclusion, the bookshop would attract younger customers if a wider range of goods were stocked, the interior was made more attractive and special prices were offered to students.

value: At present the shop only sells traditional stationery and calendars.
The prices of the products are quite high and not accessible to this demographic.
The inside of the shop is very plain and old-fashioned.

data.stimulus:
When you write a report, it's very important to choose good  subheadings.

 

 

► Review the report and select the most suitable subheading from the options in the drop down.

 

NOTE: There are some options that you don't need
data.template:
{{response}}

The purpose of this report is to suggest ways to attract more young customers to the bookshop.

{{response}}

Most of the books currently available are quite academic and therefore appeal to older customers. In order to encourage more young people to buy books, the shop should offer magazines and books on topics such as music, fashion and computers.

{{response}}

At present the shop only sells traditional stationery and calendars. It would be a good idea to expand the product range and stock items designed for young people, such as school equipment, posters, stickers, school bags and games.

{{response}}

The prices of the products are quite high and not accessible to this demographic. Discounts would encourage local students to buy their textbooks at the bookshop. In addition, leaflets should be given to schools and colleges to make students aware of these discounts.

{{response}}

The inside of the shop is very plain and old-fashioned. Young people might enjoy a more vibrant atmosphere and would be more likely to come in if the decor was modernised and the interior was painted in bright colours.

{{response}}

In conclusion, the bookshop would attract younger customers if a wider range of goods were stocked, the interior was made more attractive and special prices were offered to students.
